report.p: The piece written is a resume, with the purpose of impressing an interviewer with the candidate’s qualifications. The piece contains contact information, objectives, education, qualifications, past work experience and work skills. To start with, the author effectively understands the schema and structure of a resume, and the piece seems to be a good attempt which can use a few minor improvements. The objectives section of the resume has most room for improvement. Whilst the structure is flawless, the content could use a few improvements. The objective is three sentences long, of which two are repetitions of information provided later in the resume. “Currently a first year Computer Science major at Northeastern University. Looking for a working opportunity in the Computer Industry during the summer of 2017.” This information was provided again in the qualifications section. In my opinion the objective space could be used more effectively, perhaps to talk about your passions and concrete and realistic expectations of the role you seek in the certain company. “My aim is to work in a cutting-edge and challenging work environment, wherein I can effectively convert my innovative ideas into fruitful results”. This line could also use some improvement, because while it shows your positive intentions, it appears to be a bit vague and lacks the critical information that an interviewers wishes to see. The interviewers would like to have more information and details about your aforementioned “innovative ideas”. Perhaps share briefly with the interviewer what your ideas are. To expand a little more on my previous point, I would like to draw a comparison with my own piece. In my objective I mentioned a lot of specific details like the dates I was avaible for, the specific courses I take and the departments in the company I would like to work in. This provides the critical information an interviewer needs to give you the job
